review_title: Treat employees like responsible adults please!
job_title: Collections Specialist in Boca Raton, FL
pros: They really like the holidays! Take a half day off to decorate the office, but be sure that you finish the work that all 3 of your bosses give you first! And by that I mean 27 emails to check this or that account as soon as you sign on. They do throw you a nice going away party though!
cons: You are treated like an irresponsible child! If you have to look over their shoulder every minute then you probably should not have hired them. Seriously, everyone has to take 15min breaks at the same time.. don't clock in 3 min early or 2 min late or you will be " written up, and not eligible for the quarterly bonus" Enjoy the walk from the parking garage to the office.. no employee parking.

review_title: BocaCare not the same that BRRH

Rules are blended for some employees but hardener for others.

job_title: Paramedic in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Hopefully with Baptist taking over things will get better.
cons:
It saddens me to say this but this organization has really taken a nose dive.

When I first started working at Boca Raton Regional Hospital (BRRH) it was a great place to work.  The ER Director (who has since retired) would always tell us when one works everyone works & when one sits everyone sits. Unfortunately since her retirement things have really fallen by the wayside.  Almost all of the good nurses that worked there have moved on to other ventures due to poor work conditions and management's constantly trying  to find reasons to write everyone up or messing up schedules or being over stressed. They are being replaced with nurses that would much rather be texting or Facebooking from there desk then be bothered with patient care. The whole system has become a situation in which all the grunt work gets dumped on to the paramedics. The only thing that paramedics are not tasked with doing is administering medications.

Work conditions are not safe. We constantly had stretchers that did not work properly. The stretchers stear mode did not work causing the stretchers to swing left or right freely leaving us unable to control them safely. A couple of times I tried to compensate for it until I felt the strain on my back. When this was reported to management nothing was done.  A work order would be written up and the stretcher would have a "down tag" put on it. A week later the stretcher would be right back in use without being fixed. I suggested to management to assign an identification number to the stretcher so we could make sure the repairs were completed. They ignored the suggestion. The side rail to several stretchers would not lock in position which is potentially dangerous for the patient, leaving the hospital and staff members liable for potential injuries to the patients whom we were supposed to be caring for. When reported nothing was done. Necessary pieces of the bed like IV poles were broken and never repaired. This one in particular is true not only of the stretchers in the ER but also of the beds in the main hospital.  Mattresses that were bought and applied to the stretches were extremely grippy and made it very difficult to  slide patients from the stretcher to the bed. Yet again management ignored the problem and continued using the matresses.

It must sound like I complained all the time. These are just the facts and only a few of the items I could think to mention. I like many others that worked there would get called into the office because of anonymous complaint from other staff members.  When I expressed my displeasure with other staff members (without naming individuals) they began asking for names and situations. That is when I realized they were more interested in writing up people up and not solving problems. Truth is that leadership or lack of it is the real issue.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Boca Raton, FL
pros: Good benefits, nice hours, opportunity for overtime, no need to clock out for lunch, quick and generous accrual of PTO.
cons:
Parking. Although they are building a new parking garage on campus, employees have to suffer though at least 10 months of inconvenience.  Some people have to park off site and are shuttled to campus. The rest of the employees have to park in a garage which is a long walk from the hospital.

Favoritism and reverse discrimination. I commit a tiny infraction I am called into the office, while the rest of the people who commit the same, if not worse, infraction, nothing is said.  I resent being on the downside of the double standard, The hospital has the slogan "One Team One Mission," which sounds nice but it definitely doesn't work that way.  It is more like One Team Someone Else's Mission.

Low pay and slim opportunity for raises.  If you do get a raise, it is truly just a few cents per hour.  At that rate, one would have to work there for a lifetime until achieving a decent pay rate.

Unrealistic expectations.  We are expected to produce mass quantities, be 100% accurate (or discipline up to being fired), all in a noisy room with constant phones ringing and the expectation to answer and resolve calls.

Training (or lack thereof).  The person who was to train me really didn't want to train me, so I ended up learning more from a future coworker six months later.  Then I was made to feel stupid if I didn't know about something.

job_title: Physician Office Specialist in Deerfield Beach, FL
pros: Employees are team players, and work hard. Easy to make friends and everyone is pretty friendly. Easy job, just no room for growth. If you're looking for a stepping stone this is it!
cons: Management is awful, no direction and no structure. Management constantly giving more work without notice nor training.  No leadership, and manger is never in the office. Some providers/ employees can get gossipy or talk behind your back.

job_title: RN Emergency Department in Boca Raton, FL
pros: excellent place to work, 4:1 ratio in the ER, high tech equipment and state of the art technology
cons: the only con is that the salaries were not reviewed often. They didn't give their employees appropriate compensation- example: my pay did not go up every year that I was a nurse there. however, if they were to hire a nurse with 4 years experience, like myself, that nurse would start off at a higher pay than what I was at.

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Boca Raton, FL
